# Pooling and Servicing Agreement

## Section 1: Definitions

"Certificate" means any certificate issued pursuant to this Agreement representing a beneficial ownership interest in the Trust Fund.

"Certificateholder" means the Person in whose name a Certificate is registered in the Certificate Register.

"Distribution Date" means the 25th day of each calendar month, or if such 25th day is not a Business Day, the next succeeding Business Day.

"Master Servicer" means the entity responsible for the servicing and administration of the Mortgage Loans in accordance with this Agreement.

"Record Date" means the last Business Day of the calendar month immediately preceding the related Distribution Date.

"Remittance Report" means the monthly report prepared by the Master Servicer and delivered to the Trustee and the Certificateholders.

"Trust Fund" means the corpus of the Trust consisting of the Mortgage Loans and all other assets held by the Trustee.

## Section 2: Reporting Requirements

The Master Servicer shall deliver to the Trustee and each Certificateholder a statement (hereinafter referred to as the "Statement to Certificateholders") setting forth the following information with respect to each Distribution Date:

(a) The aggregate amount of the distribution to each class of Certificates;

(b) The amount of the distribution, if any, allocable to principal;

(c) The amount of the distribution, if any, allocable to interest;

(d) The aggregate outstanding principal balance of the Mortgage Loans as of the close of business on the last day of the related Due Period;

(e) The number and aggregate outstanding principal balance of all Mortgage Loans that were delinquent more than 30 days, 60 days, 90 days, or more;

(f) The aggregate amount of any Realized Losses incurred during the related Due Period;

(g) The weighted average Mortgage Rate and the weighted average remaining maturity of the Mortgage Loans;

(h) The Pool Factor for each class of Certificates.

## Section 3: Trustee Obligations

The Trustee shall hold the Trust Fund for the benefit of the Certificateholders. The Trustee shall not be liable for any error of judgment made in good faith.

The Trustee shall deliver to each Certificateholder on or before each Distribution Date the amounts distributable pursuant to Section 4 hereof.

## Section 4: Distributions

On each Distribution Date, the Trustee shall distribute to each Certificateholder the amounts calculated pursuant to the Remittance Report. Such distributions shall be made in the following order of priority:

First, to the holders of Class A Certificates, interest accrued at the applicable Certificate Rate;

Second, to the holders of Class A Certificates, current and previously unfunded principal;

Third, to the holders of Class B Certificates, interest accrued at the applicable Certificate Rate;

Fourth, to the holders of Class B Certificates, current and previously unfunded principal;

Fifth, any Excess Spread to the holders of the Residual Certificate.

## Section 5: Events of Default

An "Event of Default" means any one of the following:

(a) Any failure by the Master Servicer to make any distribution required under this Agreement within five Business Days after the applicable Distribution Date;

(b) Any failure by the Master Servicer to duly observe or perform any of its covenants or agreements set forth in this Agreement, which failure materially and adversely affects the interests of the Certificateholders;

(c) Any representation or warranty made by the Master Servicer proving to have been incorrect in any material respect as of the time made;

(d) The entry of a decree or order for relief by a court of competent jurisdiction in an involuntary case under any applicable federal or state bankruptcy or insolvency law.

## Section 6: Indemnification

The Master Servicer shall indemnify the Trustee against any loss, liability, or expense incurred by the Trustee in connection with the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, except for any loss caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of the Trustee.

## Section 7: Sarbanes-Oxley Compliance

The Master Servicer shall comply with the requirements of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 as applicable to the servicing of the Mortgage Loans. The Master Servicer shall deliver to the Trustee and each Rating Agency an annual assessment of compliance with the minimum servicing standards.
